definition: Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
surname Tian
field/farm/CL:片[pian4]
man
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)

sentences.english: Wandering is one of the main themes in TIAN Han's early plays.
sentences.chinese: 漂泊是田汉早期剧作主题之一。

sentences.english: This paper will focus on the study of Tianhan s early drama inditement and translation from an integrated perspective.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要分析田汉早期戏剧所受日本因素影响的。

sentences.english: Tian Han is known as a dramatist in literature history.
sentences.chinese: 文学史上的田汉以戏剧家闻名。

sentences.english: The article expounds Tian Han's Position in the history of Chinese Words of Songs.
sentences.chinese: 文章论述了田汉在中国现代歌词发展史上的地位。

definition: Ouyang Yuqian (1889-1962), Chinese actor
Xian Xinghai (1905-1945), violinist and composer, known for patriotic wartime pieces, including Yellow River Oratorio 黃河大合唱|黄河大合唱
Cao Yu (1910-1997), PRC dramatist

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Nie Er (1912-1935), musician and composer of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
Xia Yan (1900-1995), Chinese writer, playwright, socialist critic and movie pioneer
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Mei Lanfang (1894-1961), famous master of Beijing opera, specialist in female roles
Yang Kaihui (1901-1930), Mao Zedong's second wife
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
